description: This chapter discusses the true nature of apostleship, Paul's fatherly concern, and spiritual authority.

questions.question: How should people regard Paul and his fellow workers?
options: As servants of Christ and as those entrusted with the mysteries God has revealed

questions.question: What is required of those who have been given a trust?
What did Paul care very little about?
options: If he was judged by the Corinthians or by any human court

questions.question: What did Paul not do to himself?
How did Paul view his own conscience?
Who judges Paul according to his own words?
options: It is the Lord who judges me

questions.question: What does Paul warn against doing before the appointed time?
What will the Lord do when He comes?
options: He will bring to light what is hidden in darkness and will expose the motives of the heart

questions.question: What will each person receive from God?
To whom did Paul apply these things as an example?
What should believers not do beyond what is written?
How should one not become puffed up?
options: In being a follower of one of us over against the other

questions.question: What should a person not boast about as though they did not receive it?
options: And if you did receive it

questions.question: How did the Corinthians view themselves?
options: Already you have all you want! Already you have become rich! You have begun to reignâ€”and that without us!

questions.question: How did God put the apostles on display according to Paul?
options: At the end of the procession, like those condemned to die in the arena

questions.question: To whom have the apostles been made a spectacle?
options: To the whole universe, to angels as well as to human beings

questions.question: For whose sake were Paul and his fellow workers fools?
How did Paul sarcastically describe the Corinthians?
options: You are so wise in Christ

questions.question: What conditions did Paul and his fellow workers endure?
options: To this very hour we go hungry and thirsty, we are in rags, we are brutally treated, we are homeless

questions.question: With what did Paul and his fellow workers work?
options: We work hard with our own hands

questions.question: How did Paul and his fellow workers respond when mistreated?
options: When we are cursed, we bless; when we are persecuted, we endure it; when we are slandered, we answer kindly

questions.question: How were Paul and his fellow workers viewed?
options: We have become the scum of the earth, the garbage of the world

questions.question: Why did Paul write these things?
options: To warn you as my dear children

questions.question: How did Paul regard the Corinthians?
Even if the Corinthians had many guardians in Christ, how many fathers did they have?
options: Even if you had ten thousand guardians in Christ, you do not have many fathers

questions.question: How did Paul become a father to the Corinthians?
options: For in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel

questions.question: What did Paul urge the Corinthians to do?
options: Therefore I urge you to imitate me

questions.question: Whom did Paul send to the Corinthians?
How did Paul refer to Timothy?
What would Timothy remind the Corinthians of?
options: My way of life in Christ Jesus

questions.question: How had some of the Corinthians become?
Why had some people become arrogant?
options: As if I were not coming to you
Because Paul had approved of them

questions.question: When would Paul come to Corinth?
options: I will come to you very soon, if the Lord is willing

questions.question: What did Paul want to find out when he came to Corinth?
options: Not only how these arrogant people are talking, but what power they have

questions.question: What is the kingdom of God?
options: For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power

questions.question: What did Paul ask the Corinthians?
options: If they were ready to receive him
If they were ready to pray for him
If they were ready to give an offering for him
What do you prefer? Shall I come to you with a rod of discipline, or shall I come in love and with a gentle spirit?

questions.question: Who should be regarded as those entrusted with the mysteries God has revealed?
Who makes you different from anyone else?
What contrasts does Paul draw between himself and his co-workers versus the Corinthians?
options: We are fools for Christ, but you are so wise in Christ! We are weak, but you are strong! You are honored, we are dishonored!
We know the truth, you do not
We are sent by God, you are sent by men
We are blessed, you are cursed

questions.question: What did Paul want to find out about the arrogant people?
options: Both their talk and their power
Not only how these arrogant people are talking, but what power they have
